info.author: Andrew Sterian
info.description:
Sam_I_Am is an interface to Atmel AT91SAM7S microcontrollers
running the built-in SAM-BA program. It allows reading and
writing memory locations, displaying peripheral status, and
writing programs to either RAM or FLASH.

To run the program, invoke the Python interpreter on the
samiam.py file. The Sam_I_Am shell script in /usr/bin or
/usr/local/bin (or similar) can be used to perform this action.

For more details on installation or running Sam_I_Am, see the
URL below.
info.name: Sam_I_Am
info.summary: Interact with an Atmel AT91SAM7S microcontroller running SAM-BA
info.html_description:
Sam_I_Am is an interface to Atmel AT91SAM7S microcontrollers running the built-in SAM-BA program. It allows reading and writing memory locations, displaying peripheral status, and writing programs to either RAM or FLASH.

To run the program, invoke the Python interpreter on the samiam.py file. The Sam_I_Am shell script in /usr/bin or /usr/local/bin (or similar) can be used to perform this action.

For more details on installation or running Sam_I_Am, see the URL below.
